RoomTemplate.Title: &+yEntrance to the &+gThri-&+GKreen &+LCaves&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This area is a fairly narrow tunnel with a closable portcullis. Being the only possible entrance into Thannik'Tzil, it is fairly easy to defend. The large portcullis can be lowered at any time and plenty of guards are nearby to defend the settlement. The tunnel is carved from hard stone, which is quite a contrast to the soft and slippery sands outside.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yBefore A &+LCave&n&+y Entrance&n
RoomTemplate.Description: To the west is the main enterance to Thannik'Tzil and to the east is a row of merchant tents. This open space is kept between the tents and the settlement so that guards can clearly see anyone approaching and have a clear shot at them with missile fire without having to worry about disrupting the merchant tents.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yEdge of the &+YDesert&n&+y Along a Row of &nTents
RoomTemplate.Description: This area is what would be considered the "bazaar". However, commerce in Thannik'Tzil is not exactly booming. There are simply a few scattered merchants peddling their goods out of tents.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yInside a Small &nTent
RoomTemplate.Description: This tent is the businessplace of the local moneylender. Although the settlement doesn't have a very active economy, he does well enough to stay in business. There's just as much sand inside the tent as out.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yInside a Small &nTent
RoomTemplate.Description: Various pieces of armor created by Thri-Kreen craftsmen are piled upon tables made of stone. Though they are not reknowned as armorers, there are a few items of reasonable quality available.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yAlong a Row of &nTents
RoomTemplate.Description: This area is what would be considered the "bazaar". However, commerce in Thannik'Tzil is not exactly booming. There are simply a few scattered merchants peddling their goods out of tents.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yApproaching a Row of &nTents
RoomTemplate.Description: To the west a gathering of tents can be seen pitched near a sizeable stone wall. It appears that they have been placed here for no reason other than the shelter from the wind that the rock provides.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yInside a Medium-Sized &nTent
RoomTemplate.Description: This is the shop of the grocer. Though most foodstuffs are community property, visitors must purchase their food. Additionally, should a Thri want to go on a journey, he would have to provide for himself by coming here to stock up before the trip. Since many of the Thri-Kreen are travellers, the grocer does fairly well.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yInside a Large &nTent
RoomTemplate.Description: This tent is the domain of the weaponsmiths. More common and inexpensive items can be found here at the front of the tent. Toward the back are the higher-quality and better-crafted weapons.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yEdge of the &+YDesert&n&+y Near a Row of &nTents
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. A row of tents can be seen to the south and west.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Small &nTent
RoomTemplate.Description: This dusty tent is piled high with household goods and utensils. Anything from pots and pans to furnishings is available. Everything here is covered in a fairly thick layer of dust and sand despite the merchant's best efforts to keep the place clean.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Barely Discernable Path in the &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: The shifting sands nearly conceal an east-west path here. The shapes of a handful of tents can be seen some distance to the east.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yOut in the Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. Sand is blowing about at high velocity, making visibility horrible and breathing difficult.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yOut in the Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. Despite the dryness, there appears to be some life in the area.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Barely Discernable Path in the &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: The shifting sands nearly conceal an east-west path here in the desert. If it were less heavily traveled it would be completely concealed by now. The sands stretch far to the north and south from here.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yOut in the Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. The dunes here seem to slope a little more steeply than in the rest of the desert.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Path in the Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. This patch of sand is dominated by a huge rock.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Barely Discernible Path in the Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: The shifting sands nearly conceal an east-west path here in the desert. If it were less frequently traveled it would be completely invisible by now. The sands stretch far to the north and south from here.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yThe Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. The desiccated husks of a few sand lizards can be seen half-buried in the sand.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yThe Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. A few tenacious blades of desert grass cling desperately to life here.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Barely Discernable Path Near the &+YDesert&n&+y's Edge&n
RoomTemplate.Description: The shifting sands nearly conceal an east-west path here in the desert. If it were less heavily traveled, it would be completely obscured by now. The sands stretch far into the north and south.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yOut in the Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. Your tracks seem to be covered over with sand as soon as you move your feet.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yOut in the Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. A large expanse of stone can be seen far off in the distance to the north.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Well-Kept Guardroom&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This room serves as the first and primary line of defense for the settlement. Although few are brave or stupid enough to attempt to raid a Thri-Kreen lair, bands of hungry Trolls or Ogres have been known to attempt the occasional raid. The settlement is prepared for such an attack and with only one entry point is rather easy to defend. Tunnels lead off in all directions.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA North-South Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This north-south tunel is kept very clean, even though it appears to be rarely-traveled. A thin layer of sound covers the ground.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA North-South Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This north-south tunnel is kept very clean, although it appears to be fairly rarely-traveled. A thin layer of sand covers the ground.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yAn East-West Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel leads west toward a common area and east toward the entrance of the settlement. Moderate amounts of debris line the floor. Small, dark beetles can be seen scurrying underfoot.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yAn East-West Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel leads north and west toward a common area and east toward the main entrance of the settlement. Moderate amounts of debris line the tunnel. Small beetles can be seen scurrying underfoot.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Northwest-Southeast Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel appears to have been carved more recently than those in the rest of the settlement. To the southeast you see the main guard post. The tunnel continues northwest.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Northwest-Southeast Tunnel
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel appears to have been carved more recently than those in the rest of the settlement. To the west some sort of entryway can be seen.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yEntrance to the &+MMind&n&+mBender&+y's Guild&n
RoomTemplate.Description: The tunnel narrows here and is barely wide enough for two men to walk beside each other. This is clearly marked as the entrance to the mindbener's guild, home of the psionicists of the settlement.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA North-South Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel leads deeper into the Thri-Kreen settlement. The main guardpost can be seen nearby to the north. The floor is covered in a thin layer of sand that has been both blown and tracked here.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA North-South Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel leads deeper into the Thri-Kreen settlement. An intersection of tunnels can be seen nearby to the south. The floor is covered with a thin layer of sand that has been both blown and tracked here.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel Intersection&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Paths lead in all directions from this wide and well-traveled intersection. Small amounts of debris can be seen littering the floor. Mounds of sand have gathered int he corners but the center of the room has been swept clean.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel appears to be regularly traveled. Although relatively clean, a few discarded and damaged bags and crates line the corridor.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel appears to be regularly traeveled. Although kept relatively clean, a few damaged or discarded bags and boxes line the tunnel. They all appear to be empty but probably once contained food and supplies.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel appears to be fairly heavily traveled. Small amounts of debris line the floor. Worn old tapestries depicting battle scenes line the south wall.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This east-west tunnel seems to be fairly heavily traveled. Small amounts of debris line the floor. Worn old tapestries depicting active workers line the south wall.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This fairly well-traveled tunnel is littered with a small amount of debris, including what appears to be the occasional bone fragment. There is very little sand in this tunnel.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This fairly well-traveled tunnel is littered with small amounts of debris, including what appears to be the occasional bone fragment. There is very little sand on the floor.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel Intersection&n
RoomTemplate.Description: The tunnel leads east, west, and south from this intersection. All paths seem to be fairly heavily traveled. Mounds of sand have gathered in the corners but the center of the room is rather clean.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel is wider than most and appears to be fairly well-traveled. A small amount of debris lines the floor. Among the litter small scraps of metal can be seen.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel appears to be a bit wider than most. It is fairly well-traveled and a small amount of litter lines the floor. Among the litter can be seen small scraps of metal.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+BWarrior&n&+y Training Barracks&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This area is no more than a hallway lined with practice dummies. It appears to be used less frequently than the practice chamber to the south. The warriors prefer to practice their techniques on each other rather than on inanimate objects.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This hallway is kept cleaner than most. Sand is barely detectable here and it would almost be difficult to tell that this settlement was in the middle of the desert.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+BA Guarded Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This tunnel leads toward the throne room of the settlement. It is guarded from the trespass of any unwanted intruders. Weapons line the wall, some ornamental and some quite deadly. They are bolted down quite solidly and would be very difficult to remove.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+BThrone Room&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This room is decorated with many faded and worn tapestries. Although they may have once been bright and lush, the patterns have faded with age. It appears as if they have hung here for centuries. A raised platform dominates the center of the room, upon which rest two brass thrones. They are in need of a polish but are still in good shape. Perhaps they a ruler more concerned with aesthetics would find them unsuitabe, but the Thri-Kreen have not often been known for their taste.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yCommon Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This wide-open area serves as the primary residence of many of the inhabitants of &+gThannik'Tzil&n. There are no furnishings of any sort in the room. When the residents wish to sleep, they simply curl up on the floor and fall asleep. This area is fairly clean because it is the responsibility of the younger inhabitants to maintain the common area.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yFood Storage&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This is the main food storeroom of the settlement. Large piles of crates and sacks fill the room, stacked relatively neatly. There appears to be enough food stored here to feed the entire settlement for a year. There are a few sets of shackles on the walls in order to store edible prisoners such as those of sweet, yummy Elvenkind.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yGuest Dwellings&n
RoomTemplate.Description: While the Thri-Kreen generally sleep on the floor, they do realize that guests from other cultures quite prefer sleeping in a bed. This medium-sized cavern contains partitions separating it into half a dozen separate rooms, each containing a sizeable bed. The area is kept very clean and it is obvious that the settlement is interested in keeping guests happy, even if visitors are quite rare. This settlement is kept far from the main dwellings for both the safety of the residents and visitors.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yDwellings&n
RoomTemplate.Description: One of the common areas of the settlement, this area is littered with the belongings and refuse of dozens of Thri-Kreen inhabitants. The common area extends off to the north and west.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yInside a Large &nTent
RoomTemplate.Description: Well-known for his ability to craft weapons, Na'Kta maintains his shop at the back of this sizeable tent. All of the weapons are clean and have a good polish to them, despite the nearly unbearable dust of the desert terrain.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yThe Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. Loose stones litter the area. A great mound of rocks can be seen extending off to the north and west.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yThe Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span far off into the distance to the south. The rest of the area is bordered by rough rocks that extend far to the north and west.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yThe Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand. The dunes end in a towering wall of stone to the north.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yThe Open &+YDesert&n
RoomTemplate.Description: Dunes span as far as the eye can see. The occasional desert critter can be seen scurrying along the sand.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yCommon Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This wide-open area serves as the primary residence of many of the inhabitants of &+gThannik'Tzil&n. There are no furnishings of any sort in the room. When the residents wish to sleep, they simply curl up on the floor and fall asleep. This area is fairly clean because it is the responsibility of the younger inhabitants to maintain the common area.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yCommon Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This wide-open area serves as the primary residence of many of the inhabitants of &+gThannik'Tzil&n. There are no furnishings of any sort in the room. When the residents wish to sleep, they simply curl up on the floor and fall asleep. This area is fairly clean because it is the responsibility of the younger inhabitants to maintain the common area.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yCommon Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This wide-open area serves as the primary residence of many of the inhabitants of &+gThannik'Tzil&n. There are no furnishings of any sort in the room. When the residents wish to sleep, they simply curl up on the floor and fall asleep. This area is fairly clean because it is the responsibility of the younger inhabitants to maintain the common area.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yCommon Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This wide-open area serves as the primary residence of many of the inhabitants of &+gThannik'Tzil&n. There are no furnishings of any sort in the room. When the residents wish to sleep, they simply curl up on the floor and fall asleep. This area is fairly clean because it is the responsibility of the younger inhabitants to maintain the common area.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yCommon Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This wide-open area serves as the primary residence of many of the inhabitants of &+gThannik'Tzil&n. There are no furnishings of any sort in the room. When the residents wish to sleep, they simply curl up on the floor and fall asleep. This area is fairly clean because it is the responsibility of the younger inhabitants to maintain the common area.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yDwellings&n
RoomTemplate.Description: One of the common areas of the settlement, this area is littered with the belongings and refuse of dozens of Thri-Kreen inhabitants. Bits of broken furniture line the west wall.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yDwellings&n
RoomTemplate.Description: One of the common areas of the settlement, this room is littered with the belongings and refuse of dozens of Thri-Kreen inhabitants. Shredded bits of cloth line the north wall.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yDwellings&n
RoomTemplate.Description: One of the common areas of the settlement, this area is littered with the belongings and refuse of dozens of Thri-Kreen inhabitants. Although junk is scattered throughout the area, it appears to be piled mostly to the west side of the room.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yMain Hallway of the &+MMind&n&+mBender&+y's Guild&n
RoomTemplate.Description: You are in the center of the MindBender's guild. The entrance lies to the east and the guild continues in all other directions. The hallway is lit with the eerie glow of what appears to be incandescent fungus.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+mMaster's Chambers&n
RoomTemplate.Description: The walls of this room are lined with many books and figurines. The furnishings are quite fancy by Thri-kreen standards. A large desk dominates the center of the room.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yPractice Room&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This room has various objects strewn about for students to use when practicing their telekinesis or molecular agitation. Barriers and partitions are set up to minimize the danger of a detonation or misguided stone to the other students.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yMain Hallway of the &+MMind&n&+mBender&+y's Guild&n
RoomTemplate.Description: You are in the center of the mindbender's guild. The hallway appears to be lit by some sort of incandescent fungus. There are not enough psionicists in the settlement to merit their own guild, but the high psionicist holds a lot of sway. It was also thought to be a safe idea to isolate them from the rest for fear that the warriors and mindbenders might hurt each other.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yMeeting Hall and Dining Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This room serves as both a dining area and the main lecture hall of the guild. A discarded textbook and half-eaten Elf leg can be seen lying on the table. Members of the guild obviously eat better than the rest of the settlement because a piece of Elf meat would never go unfinished elsewhere.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yLiving Quarters&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This room is the dwelling for a handful of Thri-Kreen mindbenders. Various utensils and community belongings can be seen scattered throughout the room, some of which have been bent into uselessness as practice exercises.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yLibrary and Storage Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This room is stacked with piles of books, crates of food, training material, and various bags and boxes of unidentified objects. It desperately needs to be organized and it is amazing that anyone finds what they are looking for here.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yMess Hall&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This wide room is a complete and total mess. Bones and remnants of carcasses are scattered everywhere. The old smell of decay permeates the area, making it obvious that the warriors are not concerned with sanitation.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yMain Practice Arena&n
RoomTemplate.Description: The floor here is stained with blood. The walls are lined with scraps of chitin. Many broken weapons and pieces of armor damaged into uselessness area scattered about the area. It's obvious that when the Thri-Kreen practice their battle techniques they don't hold back at all.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+YCommander's Chamber&n
RoomTemplate.Description: As the office of the commander of the forces of the settlement, this room is filled with strategic maps, weapons, training manuals, and various battle trophies. A large stone desk sits in the corner of the room, situated so that the one sitting at it couldn't possibly be approached from behind.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yRecreation Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This room is set up for both practice and play. Many different objects and obstacles are strewn about here, some of which have no obvious or discernable purpose.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yMain Barracks Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This area is littered with discarded scraps of armor and weapons in desperate need of sharpening. As the main barracks of the settlement, warriors can be seen sleeping here, sometimes so many that they are nearly stacked in piles.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yMain Barracks Area&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This area is littered with discarded scraps of armor and weapons in desperate need of sharpening. As the main barracks of the settlement, warriors can be seen sleeping here, sometimes so many that they are nearly stacked in piles.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Secret Chamber Beneath The Sands&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This chamber appears to have been hollowed out hastily as a hiding place from both the rays of the sun and any living creatures that may have been searching for something. Scraps of canvas and wood barely hold the sand at bay and keep it from filling the hole back in.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yThe Hatching Grounds&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This room is where the youngest Thri-Kreen come into being. Small chambers carved into the stone walls house dozens of eggs. This room is kept clean and well-maintained. The Thri-Kreen value their young greatly, which is why this room is normally well-guarded.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Partially-Collapsed Tunnel&n
RoomTemplate.Description: The stone here is too soft to dig down any deeper. This room is filled with sand and crumbling stone. It was once intended to become more dwellings, but the diggers found that they had to progress in other directions.

RoomTemplate.Title: &+yA Hidden &+LPrison&n
RoomTemplate.Description: This cleverly concealed room is the place where visitors who misbehave and are inedible are left to die of starvation. The Thri-Kreen aren't completely cruel - they do feed their prisoners. When they remember. It's not easy to remember that sort of thing when someone is locked away in a hidden chamber.

ObjTemplate.Name: chatkcha worn
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yA chatkcha that has seen better days lies here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: lizard belt
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+gA belt of lizard skin rests here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: bracelet stone
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A bracelet made of polished stone rests here.

ObjTemplate.Name: rock jagged
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yA jagged &+Lrock&n&+y rests here, slowly being smoothed by the swirling sands.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: bones bleached pile
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+WA sun-bleached pile of bones lies here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: cactus saguaro
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+gA giant saguaro cactus stands here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: gythka stone
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A stone gythka lies here.

ObjTemplate.Name: balanced mithril gythka weapon strange
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A strange-looking weapon lies on the ground here.

ObjTemplate.Name: shuriken
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A shuriken sits on the ground here.

ObjTemplate.Name: knife throwing
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A throwing knife sticks point-first into the ground.

ObjTemplate.Name: axe throwing small
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A small axe rests here.

ObjTemplate.Name: folded steel katana sharp
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A sharp steel katana rests here.

ObjTemplate.Name: engraved mithril katana fancy
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A fancy katana has been tossed on the ground.

ObjTemplate.Name: crystalline wakizashi crystal
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: An crystal wakizashi lies here.

ObjTemplate.Name: daikyu sleek dagger
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A dagger lies here.

ObjTemplate.Name: lizard hide skullcap cap
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+gA cap made of hide rests here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: lizard skin gorget
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+gA gorget made of skin rests here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: heavy black mace big
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+LA big black mace lies here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: crystalline breastplate crystal
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+WA crystal breastplate lies here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: armplates bone pair pile plates arm
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: An pile of bone plates lies here.

ObjTemplate.Name: bronze gloves pair
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yA bronze pair of gloves sits here.

ObjTemplate.Name: bracer bronze
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yA bronze bracer sits here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: leaded glass visor thick
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A thick glass visor rests here in the dirt.

ObjTemplate.Name: axe training lead heavy
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A heavy lead axe sits here.

ObjTemplate.Name: shiv wicked
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A &+Lwicked-looking&n shiv lies here.

ObjTemplate.Name: embroidered blue robe fancy
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+bA fancy blue robe lies here in a crumpled heap.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: longsword steel sword sharp
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A sharp steel longsword rests here.

ObjTemplate.Name: tattered cloth mask piece
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+rA piece of cloth lies here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: tattered cloth sleeves pair
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+rA beat-up pair of sleeves lies here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: corpse mantis thri thri-kreen
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: The corpse of a &+gmantis warrior&n lies here, rotting.

ObjTemplate.Name: bone dagger crude piece
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A piece of bone lies here.

ObjTemplate.Name: bracelet stone runed
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A stone bracelet covered in runes rests here.

ObjTemplate.Name: elf scalp
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+gThe scalp of an Elf lies here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: chatkcha crystal
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yA &+Wcrystal&n chatkcha has been fumbled here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: chatkcha crystal worn
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yAn old &+Wcrystal&n chatkcha has been dropped here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: chatkcha crystal sharp
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yA sharp &+Wcrystal&n chatkcha has been tossed here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: chatkcha crystal deadly
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yA sharp &+Wcrystal&n chatkcha has been tossed here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: chatkcha crystal deadly
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yA heavy &+Wcrystal&n chatkcha has been left here.&n

ObjTemplate.Name: key brass plain
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A key lies here in the dirt.

ObjTemplate.Name: key iron plain
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: A key lies here in the dirt.

ObjTemplate.Name: gauntlets pair steel
ObjTemplate.FullDescription: &+yA bronze pair of gloves sits here.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This worm feeds itself by swallowing rocks and using its digestive acids to extract the minerals from them. It looks harmless enough but is probably fairly dangerous if provoked.
MobTemplate.Description: &+yA worm slithers here, munching on some rocks&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This snake lies here, waiting for the next creature stupid enough to cross its path. It appears better fed than most of the creatures roaming the desert.
MobTemplate.Description: &+yA &+Yrattle&n&+gsnake &+ycoils here, ready to strike.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This spindly bird stares at you with its bulging eyes. It knows you will probably be one of the next to fall prety to the roaring desert heat and is prepared to wait for its opportunity to pick the flesh from your bones.
MobTemplate.Description: &+LA &+Wvulture &+Lwaits here, hoping the &n&+ydesert&+L will claim another victim.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This coyote looks rather underfed. There is a discernable look of desperation in his eyes and he is ready to fight anyone or anything for his next meal.
MobTemplate.Description: &+yA &+wcoyote&+y is here, searching for a meal.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This spider scurries through the desert, looking for insects and small mammals to feed on. It looks fairly dangerous.
MobTemplate.Description: &+wA &+Ltarantula&n&+w moves silently across the desert.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This Thri-Kreen specializes in creating inexpensive throwing weapons. He has found his niche and doesn't try to compete with the premier weaponsmith. The demand for weapons here is just great enough to keep him in business.
MobTemplate.Description: &+YT'Klihk&n&+y stands here, displaying his selection of weaponry.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: Na'Kta is the best weaponsmith known to the Thri-Kreen settlement. Though he is capable of great work, which can be seen in the hands of the more prominent denizens of the settlement, he tends to make items of average quality due to the demand for large quantities of inexpensive weapons. He makes a good living.
MobTemplate.Description: &+rNa'Kta&+y the &+rBloody&+y stands here, selling various weapons.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: L'Nathka specializes in used armor. Most of the items that pass through his hands are fairly low-quality bronze or hide pieces, but he does deal in the occasional piece of steel.
MobTemplate.Description: &+BL'Nathka&n stands here, polishing some armor.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c sentinel stands here, protecting the area.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: Zralkis is an old and very wise Thri-Kreen. Grandson of the first psionicist in the settlement, he holds his rightful place beside Auraxx. As the second most powerful resident of the settlement, he presides over the actions of the Mindbender's guild. His power and skill are known to all, and none dare attack him.
MobTemplate.Description: &+mZralkis&n, high psionicist of &+gThannik'Tzil&n stands here.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: Auraxx, leader of the settlement, is a very large and very strong warrior. He stands half a foot taller than the tallest of Thri-Kreen and has the demeanor of nobility about him. He moves with a swiftness and precision that makes him very dangerous.
MobTemplate.Description: &+BAuraxx&n, high master of &+gThannik'Tzil&n stands here.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This muscular warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests. The hard look in his eyes would suggest the latter.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA burly &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c sentinel stands here, protecting the area.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c sentinel stands here, protecting the area.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c guard watches the area.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c commoner stands here.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This Thri-Kreen is part of a rare group that is the result of a strange mutation. He has somehow developed strange mental abilities that allow him the powers of a psionicist.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c mindbender stands here.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA young &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c stands here.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA burly &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c commoner stands here.

MobTemplate.PlayerName: klaxx thri thri-kreen master mind mindfolder
MobTemplate.FullDescription: This robed thri-kreen exudes a dangerous self-confidence. He has an aura about him that warns his would-be attackers that it would be very unwise to threaten him. Descended from a genetic mutant, he is one of the rare psionicists in the settlement.
MobTemplate.Description: &+mKlaxx, the master mindfolder stands here.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: A battle-hardened Thri-Kreen, Nixxix has seen many battle campaigns. His prowess as a warrior has enabled him to avoid most of the scars that would normally be seen on a warrior of his age and stature. He appears always aware of his surroundings. He looks pretty angry about something.
MobTemplate.Description: &+yNixixx, commander of the military, stands here waiting to hurt someone.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior is straining to swing his weapon. He has been given a very heavy axe to practice with and he is having a hard time wielding it.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA struggling &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c warrior tries to practice here.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior knows how to fight and is ready to take on any challenge that may present itself.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA strong &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c warrior is ready for anything.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior knows how to fight and is ready to take on any challenge that may present itself. He appears to be a little unseasoned, but he is eager to test himself on the battlefield.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c warrior is prepared to fight.&n

MobTemplate.PlayerName: thri thri-kreen mindbender mind bender neophyte
MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA neophyte &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c mindbender stands here.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This rogue no doubt escaped from the clutches of the Thri-Kreen and is hiding out in the desert, trying to elude recapture. Unsure of his way, he has dug a secret hiding spot and hopes to elude discovery. One such as him would be considered quite a delicacy within the settlement.
MobTemplate.Description: &+LA scared &+GElven&+L rogue is here, trying to hide.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: Klikta is the only grocer known to the Thri-Kreen settlement. Most of the food in the settlement is provided, so there is little need for his services except from a resident in need of a quick snack or the rare visitor to the area.
MobTemplate.Description: &+RKlikta&+y the merchant stands here, selling food.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA very young &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c skitters around here.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This lizard scurries along the dunes, relying on its speed to protect it from predators.
MobTemplate.Description: &+gA lizard scurries about the &+gdesert&+g, looking for some shade.&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This worm feeds itself by swallowing rocks and using its digestive acids to extract the minerals from them. It looks harmless enough but is probably fairly dangerous if provoked. This larval worm looks like it has just recently hatched.
MobTemplate.Description: &+yA small worm slithers here, munching on some rocks&n

MobTemplate.FullDescription: This muscular warrior has a few battle scars here and there, but is not as scarred as the average Thri-Kreen warrior. Either he has not truly been tested in battle, or he has fared quite well in his tests. The hard look in his eyes would suggest the latter.
MobTemplate.Description: &+cA &+gThri-&+GKreen&n&+c guardian stands here, protecting the eggs.

MobTemplate.FullDescription: &+r This minotaur is shackled here. He looks desperate to be freed. His iron shackles are very strong and even his brute strength is powerless against them. He looks half-starved and he has a desperate look in his eyes.&n
MobTemplate.Description: &+rA &+LMinotaur&N&+r is shackled here, desperate to be rescued.

QuestData.Complete: Thank you for slaying him. Here is your reward.

TalkData.Message: My dinner has escaped! Bring me the scalp of that blasted Elf and I will reward you. Not only is my meal now ruined, but my reputation is now in jeopardy!

QuestData.Disappear: Thank you! I can finally return home! That is if those insect bastards haven't destroyed it yet...
QuestData.Complete: You've brought me the correct key! Thank you so much! Here is the only item they left me with. I hope you find them useful.

TalkData.Message: I need a key to free me from my shackles. I know not who carries it. All of these insects look alike to me. Please, help me free myself!
